\n
\n
\n

\nThe Web Governance Food Pyramid\n

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n8/26/14 10:02 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n

Don’t worry, I’m not here to tell you that 4 cups of coffee a day and a granola bar for lunch doesn’t constitute proper adult nutrition. In fact, top that off with a pack of Twizzlers® and a Red Bull® and you’ve got yourself the first meal out of the official Corporate America Cookbook (on newsstands never). However, I am going to tell you that your Web Governance Strategy needs to have a solid structure and balanced combination of essential components in order to properly manage and maintain your organization’s online presence.

\n

And what might those components be? I’m glad you asked.

\n

\n

\n

Resources

\n

Resources comprise all of the tools, software, and hardware that your web team uses to create, publish, and monitor your web content. This includes things like your CMS (WordPress), publishing tools (HubSpot), and web governance tools (*cough*Siteimprove*cough*).

\n

If your web governance strategy were a house, think of your resources as the physical tools you would use to build and maintain it, like hammers, screwdrivers, and paintbrushes.

\n

People

\n

Your web team; the ones who do the heavy lifting when it comes to creating content, fixing potential errors, and ensuring a consistent user experience.

\n

The Roles & Responsibilities for your web team should be clearly defined in order to prioritize projects, avoid miscommunication over who is responsible for addressing certain tasks, and spread the workload evenly among the team.

\n

If your web governance strategy were a house, think of your people as the ones building the frame, installing the wires, and putting on the fresh coat of paint.

\n

Process

\n

How you do what you do. Your process defines how and why content is created, where it gets published, and who is responsible for monitoring its performance. This should include your social media, SEO, and analytics practices, as all of these pieces will help you identify the content that resonates with your audience.

\n

Knowing what works and what doesn’t will allow you to tailor future content around your audience’s needs, and update older content to be more relevant.

\n

If your web governance strategy were a house, think of your process as the workflow that dictates which pieces of the house get built first (foundation, frame, wiring, walls, fixtures, etc)

\n

Policy & Standards

\n

We recently detailed the difference between Policies and Standards, but they’re essentially the guidelines which detail your organization’s online goals and how you plan to achieve them.

\n

These should be broad, high-level ideas that are shared by the entire organization, but with a twist that applies to the digital ecosystem.

\n

If your Web Governance strategy were a house, think of your Policy & Standards as the blueprint. It should act as a point of reference for your team to work from in order to reach your goals.

\n

Now that your website is on the path to healthy living, download our helpful web governance checklist to make sure you keep it that way.

\n

\n \n \n

\n
\n

\n
\n

Siteimprove Web Governance Suite: The only web governance software that helps you better manage and maintain your website through quality assurance, accessibility, web analytics, SEO, and response – all in one tool.

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n 9028099743:\n\n\n\n\n\nSiteimprove Webinar: Online Governance For Government\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n

On-Demand Webinar: Online Governance For Government

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

In this on-demand webinar, we examine how successful this new approach to Web Governance has been and identify some key lessons you can apply to your own operations. You may have heard it said that "democracy is a precious nectar carried around in the rusty bucket of human endeavor". Well, rarely has that bucket been more rusty than when applied to how democratic government conducts itself online.

\n

Experience shows that after lots of heady initial enthusiasm and conspicuous spending, many government websites are abandoned and left to suffer a long decline.

\n

Thankfully, that is starting to change. A new recognition of the need to spend wisely is creating a more mature approach to Web Governance. One of the leading proponents of this change is the UK government, which since 2012 has undertaken a huge project to centralize hundreds of state bodies and ministerial departments into a single online presence. At the beginning of this project a series of recommendations were made regarding online operations. The result was a new body with the authority to lead all online development and set the rules by which things must be done. 

\n

 

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

\n
\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n   \n
\n

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\n 9028099793:\n\n\n\n\n\nTwo Approaches to Better Web Governance in Your University\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

On-Demand Webinar: Two Approaches to Better Web Governance in Your University

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

In this webinar, you'll learn about a new "Framework of Web Governance". This framework can improve your online management in 3 crucial ways and is particularly suitable for large, complex organizations like universities.

\n
    \n
  1. It helps sort the wood from the trees, by putting order on the often dizzying complexity of web operations.
    2. \n
  2. It has predictive qualities and can be used to plan a configuration of governance that is suitable for you.
    3. \n
  3. It can be used as a communications tool to help build a business case for investment in web management.
    4. \n
\n

Ultimately, this framework will give you the confidence you need to design a better system of management and lead to enhanced decisions in such critical areas as staffing, technology, budgeting & more

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

\n
\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Health Care

\n

Maintaining a health care website is tricky: Typically no one knows who’s adding what content, and management is upset when mistakes inevitably appear. Other responsibilities prevent web teams from delving into SEO, ensuring their websites are fully accessible to disabled visitors, and making the most of complicated analytics tools. Siteimprove can help!

\nRequest a Demo\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

Siteimprove for Health Care

\n

Siteimprove’s Web Governance Suite makes it easy to maintain your site’s quality, whether you’re a one-(wo/man) band or an entire web team. Project management tools, website inventories, detailed reporting for broken links, misspellings, Search Engine Optimization and accessibility issues – all coupled with analytics software so intuitive you’ll actually use it.

\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
    \n
  • \n
    \n

    Improve your site’s usability, SEO and credibility

    \n

    With unique and simple features, Siteimprove Quality Assurance directs your attention where it’s needed most, correcting errors before they grow. Its intuitive user interface includes language and spelling management, broken link identification, a complete inventory overview of media files and documents, and access to custom reporting.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Access to Complete Inventory

    \n

    Get a comprehensive overview of media files, PDFs, and other documents across multiple websites. Find every instance of sensitive details like email addresses, phone numbers and social security numbers, plus utilize our simple diagrams which show which sites contain what media files, email addresses, and more

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Check website accessibility issues WCAG 2.0

    \n

    Issues and Guidelines in Siteimprove Accessibility checks and identifies the WCAG 2.0 success criteria conformance levels A, AA and AAA for ensuring accessible web content. For instance, missing text alternatives, such as success criteria 1.1.1 Non-text Content which affects screen readers accessing images and even search engine performance. Siteimprove Accessibility also helps list and prioritize errors, flags warnings and allows you to review and ignore WGAG 2.0 issues accordingly.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Check online PDF document accessibility errors

    \n

    As well as scanning web pages for WCAG 2.0 accessibility issues Siteimprove Accessibility also scans all of your site’s PDFs for detectable issues as part of WCAG 2.0 / ISO 14289-1:2012 / Matterhorn Protocol. This includes full document and single page element accessibility issues affecting usability, from missing headings and bookmarks to images without alternative text.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Schedule and Customize Reports

    \n

    Siteimprove Quality Assurance custom reports are delivered directly to your inbox, with prioritized error lists directing your attention to where it’s needed most. Plus generate, schedule and customize unlimited report templates to suit you or your staff’s needs.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n

What's included?

\n
\n
    \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    \nUnlimited Live Support & Training

    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    \nOnline training

    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    \nOnline Support
    \nServices

    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    \nFree Updates

    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    \nUnlimited
    \nUsers

    \n

Happy clients

\n

Here's what they have to say about us

\n
\n
    \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    Every company with a large website should use Quality Assurance from Siteimprove. Nowadays, your website is your brick and mortar, so reputable content and accurate information is key to any brand. Siteimprove will streamline the process and easily point out any errors or inconsistencies.

    \n
    \nInternet Specialist at Saint Joseph Mercy Health System
    \n
    \n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    Siteimprove Quality Assurance, quite simply put is indispensable. I manage a higher ed website with thousands of pages and since incorporating Siteimprove into our maintenance schedule I have confidence that users will not find broken links or spelling errors, both which erode our credibility as an institution of higher learning. Whether a broken link is the result of a change from an external site we are linked to or a domino effect from something we have done elsewhere on the site, Siteimprove alerts us to the problem and we can address the issue quickly. The ability to segment and share the reports enables those closest to specific content to be involved in a productive and expedient way.

    \n
    \nAssistant Director of Communications at Cornell University
    \n
    \n
    \n

Legal

\n

The legal profession is characteristically information rich, yet time poor. This can often lead to growing web governance issues, especially for larger organizations with multiple web pages that contain high levels of personal information, such as a lawyer database. Siteimprove can help!

\nRequest a Demo\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

Siteimprove for Legal Services

\n

It’s easy to have a complete overview of all website content, increase firm visibility, ensure error-free website content, and demonstrate a ROI via easy-to-use analytics. All of which provides greater information protection, improves efficiency across the entire organization, and supports better access to accurate and current information on your firm’s website.

\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
    \n
  • \n
    \n

    Access to Complete Inventory

    \n

    Get a comprehensive overview of media files, PDFs, and other documents across multiple websites. Find every instance of sensitive details like email addresses, phone numbers and social security numbers, plus utilize our simple diagrams which show which sites contain what media files, email addresses, and more.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Measure traffic sources and campaign tracking

    \n

    Traffic Sources allows you to view, filter and segment what search engines and external websites have been used to access your website so you can easily attribute access routes. Plus apply Siteimprove Analytics Campaign tracking and Parameters to email, social media and offline advertising so you can home in on which channels are most successfully driving traffic. You can also see external search engine terms, helping you identify what your visitors are searching for to enter your website.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Manage keywords and page optimization relationships

    \n

    Siteimprove SEO Keywords helps monitor your website’s target keywords on their corresponding pages and indicates average Google rankings so you can effectively optimize page by page. Additionally, Page Analyses functionality helps provide meaningful keyword score data, based on content SEO issues, ranking, visits from search engines and bounce rate. Plus this data also provides useful keyword suggestions taken from organic search results, so you can determine which keywords you should be optimizing for using Siteimprove SEO.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Check coding technicalities affecting searchability

    \n

    Siteimprove SEO Searchability checks and monitors technical code on your website which  has a direct impact on optimization, as search engines look to crawl them. These include XML Sitemap un-crawled URLs, robot.txt and no-index/no-follow page exclusions from search results and duplicate rel canonical. If you are looking to optimize your website for search engine crawlers, this is a smart way to get started.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Schedule and Customize Reports

    \n

    Siteimprove Quality Assurance custom reports are delivered directly to your inbox, with prioritized error lists directing your attention to where it’s needed most. Plus generate, schedule and customize unlimited report templates to suit you or your staff’s needs.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n

\n
    \n
  • \n
    \n\n

    \n

    \nUsers

Happy clients

\n

Here's what they have to say about us

\n
\n
    \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    The Web Governance Suite is one of our best investments. The quality assurance tool enabled us to clean up a plethora of content on our website, as well as gives us the ability to proactively monitor new material. As someone who deals with a magnitude of software and apps, I can truly appreciate when something comes along that actually makes my life easier.

    \n
    \nManager of Marketing Technology at Blank Rome LLP.
    \n
    \n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n\n
    \n

    Siteimprove SEO breaks down search engine optimization into an easy-to-understand format that allows us to interpret our strengths and weaknesses clearly and efficiently. We’ve been able to utilize this information to modify our website to improve our search rankings and easily explain our progress to the firm’s business development committee with concise monthly reports provided by Siteimprove. I strongly recommend Siteimprove SEO.

    \n
    \nMarketing Coordinator at Larkin Hoffman
    \n
    \n
    \n

On-Demand Webinar: Web Accessible Multimedia

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

Multimedia content is more engaging and shareable than its text-only counterparts (Hubspot 2013). Making this content more accessible for your users is a simple process, so long as you consider web accessibility guidelines while adding this kind of content to your site. With improvements in bandwidth, as well as browsers and media players, you have an opportunity to deliver an engaging, rich media experience to your visitors. Unfortunately, if you don’t prepare properly, the experience will be less accessible, and more frustrating to your visitors. 

\n

In this on-demand web accessibility webinar, we discuss how to ensure that your multimedia content is web accessible to people with disabilities, by discussing how to meet WCAG guidelines, and then give you a few ways to begin improving your website’s multimedia delivery. We take a look at:

\n
    \n
  • WCAG time-based media criteria
    • \n
  • Transcripts, captions, & audio descriptions
    • \n
  • Keyboard accessibility and keyboard traps
    • \n
  • User controls/player accessibility
    • \n
  • Video delivery systems- You tube & Video
    • \n
  • HTML5
    • \n
  • WAI-ARIA
    • \n
\n

 

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

\n
\n\n\n
\n
\n

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\n 9089760913:\n\n\n\n\n\nCase Study: D’Youville College\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

D’Youville College

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

Thank you for requesting our case study!

\n


Click here to download the case study

\n

This case study gives a brief explanation of how D’Youville College uses Siteimprove to overcome issues commonly faced by small college web teams.

\n
\n

Like to learn more? Click to Request a Demo

\n

Managing websites can be tricky, especially the more pages it has, and the more people responsible for its content.

\n

Siteimprove’s Web Governance Suite helps organizations manage and maintain their websites through:

\n
    \n
  • Web Quality Assurance
    • \n
  • Web Accessibility
    • \n
  • Web Analytics
    • \n
  • Search Engine Optimization Analysis
    • \n
  • Web Performance Alerts
    • \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

\n\n
\n© 2015 Siteimprove Inc\n

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\n 9028097193:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWeb Analytics, Measure Website Traffic | Siteimprove\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\n\n\n\n\n
\n\n

\n
\n\n
\nMenu\n
\n
\n\n

      \n
    • Quality Assurance
      • \n
    • Accessibility
      • \n
    • Analytics
      • \n
    • SEO
      • \n
    • Response
      • \n
    \n

\n

Know your visitors better than they know themselves

\n

With budgets continuing to tighten, and workloads increasing, web analytics has become a must-have in every professional’s toolbox. However, for many it is still difficult to distinguish between reliable data and valid data. Siteimprove Analytics provides you better insight needed to help drive more informed decision making.

\nRequest a Demo\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

Why pay when I can get a free tool?

\n

This is a question we often hear and the answer is really quite simple – because with a paid tool YOU own and are in control of the data, plus you gain access to a wealth of information that the free tools simply don’t offer. With Siteimprove Analytics, there are no data limitations, it’s simple and easy to use, and when you need help it’s a phone call or email away, at no extra cost.

\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
    \n
  • \n
    \n

    See visitor journeys across your site

    \n

    User Journeys shows you how users are navigating your site, and in turn enables you to take this information and use it actively in connection with the structure of the website to make popular destinations more visible. By analyzing the most popular user journeys in Siteimprove Analytics, you can ensure that popular content can be reached in just a few clicks.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    See interaction page by page

    \n

    Look at how visitors interact with your site page by page, and see pages’ popularity to help focus your efforts. Moreover, use real-time data to optimize your site and ensure users stay longer.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    See visitor types and platform user trends

    \n

    The Visitor section in Siteimprove Analytics displays and reports numbers of visits and bounce rate by country, organization, browser, operating system and screen resolution so you can quickly identify and report exactly how and where users access your website.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Schedule, export and customize Analytics reports

    \n

    Siteimprove Analytics reports are clear and easy to understand for any user accessing them. Choose between pre-set report templates, or custom tailored ones, and have scheduled and unlimited reports sent to your inbox, for greater control. You can also readily export data from each Siteimprove Analytics feature into MS Excel and XML formats.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Receive and analyze real user feedback

    \n

    Feedback is a fully integrated, customized add-on for Siteimprove Analytics and is free from coding and installation. It collects user feedback via questions or ratings, and can be added to as many, or as few, pages as you wish.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Measure traffic sources and campaign tracking

    \n

    Traffic Sources allows you to view, filter and segment what search engines and external websites have been used to access your website so you can easily attribute access routes. Plus apply Siteimprove Analytics Campaign tracking and Parameters to email, social media and offline advertising so you can home in on which channels are most successfully driving traffic. You can also see external search engine terms, helping you identify what your visitors are searching for to enter your website.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Measure clicks on broken links and analyze SEO

    \n

    Siteimprove Analytics is fully integrated with Siteimprove Quality Assurance and Accessibility; this makes it possible to measure user clicks on broken links leading to 404 pages and see page views on erroneous content so you can effectively priorities pages which need most attention. This can also help contribute to understanding why certain pages might have a higher bounce rate. What’s more, by using Siteimprove SEO and Analytics integration you can delve deep into keywords analysis, page optimization and search engine KPIs.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Record internal search terms and actions

    \n

    Siteimprove Analytics Internal Search shows you what visitor search terms have been entered into your website’s search solution. This helps develop your content strategy by understanding which searches have unsuccessful and successful results and which search term results contribute to the user immediately leaving the website.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n
    \n

    Behavior tracking with filters and segmentation

    \n

    Behavior Tracking in Siteimprove Analytics gives you a clear overview of how visitors are entering your site and how they navigate around. Easily identify if there are pages which do not function as intended or have a large visitor drop off rate. Select a focus page, and see if visitors are following the routes you were expecting them to, and identify areas for improvement using intuitive filters and segmentation analysis. Also, simply check the most popular external links in Siteimprove Analytics that are used to exit your site.

    \n
    \n
    \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

The Siteimprove Customer Experience

\n

Online support services - Access product information, software updates and technical support resources online within the tool.

\n

Expert technical assistance - Siteimprove’s trained Customer Experience team is available to provide free expert advice and assistance for all your training and support needs.

\n

Full upgrade protection - Software upgrades and documentation are free, ensuring you stay current on the latest technical developments.

\n

\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n

Latest news.

\n

Your one stop spot for all the latest news about what we’ve been up to, what we plan on doing, plus plenty of extra exciting announcements about everything from web governance news, customer visits, partnerships, sponsorship’s, awards and much more.

Siteimprove Promotes From Within, Names New VP of Customer Success

\n
\n

BY Star Bazella

\n

8. Sep 2014

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

Software as a service (SaaS) company, Siteimprove, has named Steve Hennigs as their new Vice President of Customer Success. Hennigs has been with Siteimprove since opening their U.S. office in 2007 and previously occupied the role of Senior Product Specialist.

\n

Hennigs will be heading up the newly created Customer Success Team, which will aim to bridge the gap between sales and support by providing ongoing customer communication, product on-boarding, and updates. The ultimate goal for Hennigs and Siteimprove will be to ensure that every customer is equipped with the knowledge, resources, and support that they need in order to get the most out of their investment.

\n

“We’ve always provided a smooth on-boarding process for new customers, as well as thorough training and technical support,” said Hennigs. “However, it was important that we not leave any gaps in our customer communication. Now, instead of being reactive to customer questions and needs, we’re able to take that first step and help them identify actionable solutions to their unique challenges.”

\n

Hennigs wants customers to know that his team is here to help them find the best use of the Siteimprove tool. From website management and maintenance duties, to SEO, analytics, and accessibility optimization, the Customer Success Team will be the first point of contact for customers.

\n

Each Siteimprove customer will have a dedicated Customer Success Manager whom they can contact with any questions, technical issues, or ideas for tool improvements. “Knowing who to ask and where to find them will allow our customers to receive the specialized support that they deserve,” said Hennigs.

\n

Though the team is only a few months old, they have already made a significant impact in the customer communication efforts, contacting and on-boarding nearly 20% of Siteimprove’s 2,000 existing clients.

\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

Siteimprove | Ask Us Anything OnDemand Webinar

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

We get a lot of great questions about how to get the most out of our tools, web governance best practices, creating engaging content, and more. It didn’t take long to realize that many of you had the same questions, so we decided to lock our resident experts in a room together and make them available to answer your burning questions.

\n

In this Ask Us Anything recording we cover a variety of topics including: 

\n
    \n
  • How to increase content lifecycles 
    • \n
  • Are HTML emails web accessible? 
    • \n
  • How to create Siteimprove reports via sections- ie. arts-edu
    • \n
  • Tips on how to find the right SEO consultant
    • \n
\n
\n

\n

Our Expert Panel: Steve Hennigs- Siteimprove's Vice President of Customer Success, Kevin Rydberg- Siteimprove's Senior eAccessibility Consultant, Heather Orfe- Siteimprove's Technical Support & Training Manager, Star Bazella- Siteimprove's Director of Marketing, Shane Diffily- Independent Web Governance Consultant & Author of The Website Manager's Handbook

\n

Thank you for requesting our case study!

This case study gives a brief explanation of how the City of St. Louis Park uses Siteimprove to overcome issues commonly faced by city web teams.

\n
\n

Like to learn more? Click here to Request a Demo

\n

Managing websites can be tricky, especially the more pages it has, and the more people responsible for its content.

Siteimprove’s Web Governance Suite helps organizations manage and maintain their websites through:

\n
    \n
  • Web Quality Assurance
    • \n
  • Web Accessibility
    • \n
  • Web Analytics
    • \n
  • Search Engine Optimization Analysis
    • \n
  • Web Performance Alerts
    • \n

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n\n 9561291483:\n\n\n\n\n\nHow Can SEO Benefit Brick & Mortar Banks?\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n

    • \n

Siteimprove Web Governance Blog

\n
\n
\n

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

\nHow Can SEO Benefit Brick & Mortar Banks?\n

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n11/18/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n

Online banking is awesome. Everyone knows that. Checking balances, paying bills, transferring money, even depositing checks; online banking has made it easy for people to manage their basic finances from the comfort of their home computer or mobile device.

\n

But what about more complicated financial activities like applying for home and auto loans, planning for retirement, savings investments, or managing small business expenses? The average person will have questions. They’ll need information on how to start planning and who to trust with their money. And where does the average person begin their search for answers? That’s right, online.

\n\n

Here’s some stats. People love stats.

\n
    \n
  • 92% of adults rely on the Internet when beginning their search for information, products, and services.
    • \n
  • The average cost of an online bank transaction is $0.10, compared to a $0.94 cost of phone transactions and $1.00 cost of branch transactions.
    • \n
\n

SEO is tricky, and it’s constantly evolving, but there are a few tried and true methods for increasing your online search performance.

\n

Keyword strategy

\n

Don’t try to be everything to everyone. Identify what your bank does best and know what questions customers in your area have, then use that information to focus your SEO efforts on a small number of specific keywords.

\n

Use short tail and long tail keywords to expand your reach. To put it simply, short tail keywords are broad terms like “Banking” or “Auto loans”. These will help you reach a broad audience, but may not always reach the right audience. Long tail keywords are more specific terms that help narrow the search, like “Banking services in Chicago” or “Auto loan refinancing”. These types of keywords will help you hone in on a specific segment of your potential audience.

\n

Short tail keywords will maximize your exposure, while long tail keywords will help you reach the right audience and keep your costs down as the competition (and cost) for more specific keywords is far lower.

\n

Provide high-quality content

\n

Yes, ranking well for targeted keywords like “mortgage rates” or “retirement planning” is great for exposure, but you need to back up that ranking with quality content that provides usable information.

\n

You need to understand what questions your audience has, and provide them with answers that are both easy to find and easy to understand. Leave out the sales pitches and industry jargon. Most people won’t know what you’re talking about, and they need to feel comfortable if they’re going to trust you with their money.

\n

Include outbound links

\n

Search engines will view your site as a more reliable source of information and reward you with a better SEO ranking if you support your site’s content by linking to other reputable sources (outbound links), like the FDIC, Wall Street Journal, or Forbes.

\n

You can also double-dip by getting others to provide links (inbound links) to your site or blog, just be wary of link-building schemes, as these can damage your SEO rankings and reputation with customers.

\n

Leverage social media & blogging

\n

Blogs add additional pages to your website that boost your SEO performance for given keywords. You can use your blog to go beyond the information provided on your website and provide more detailed information about specific topics, address concerns and misconceptions, or provide tips and tricks for first time investors or new home owners.

\n

Social media provides an SEO boost as well, especially Google+. Yes, believe it or not, Google’s search algorithm significantly rewards those who actively post content to their social network, but they also scan Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

\n

Use your social networks to provide users with bite-size pieces of information that drive them to your website for the main course.

\n

Yes, the conversation will begin online, but the ultimate goal is to drive customers to your bank in order to complete the transaction.

\n

Part of the reason people love online banking is that it makes them feel comfortable by allowing them to be in control. By using your online presence to connect with them in a personal, approachable way, you’ll bridge the gap that exists between the comfort of online banking and the uncertainty they may feel over making a larger financial decision.

\n

\n \n \n

\n

Image courtesy of twobee at FreeDigitalPhotos.net

\n
\n

Topics:\nSEO,\nWeb Governance,\nContent\n

Roles and responsibilities in Web Governance

\n

\nPosted by\nBo Vejgaard\n

\n

\n10/10/12 3:59 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Do all employees in your organization know what their role is, and what is expected of them? Do employees know who to ask questions outside their own work area? Do you know what every employee in your web team does?

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Awards

\n

\nPosted by\nDave Schneider\n

\n

\n6/13/12 10:50 AM\n

\n
\n\n

    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n

  • \n\n

\n\n

\n\n\n\n

\n
\n

It's official: we're fun.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Map your current web governance

\n

\nPosted by\nBo Vejgaard\n

\n

\n5/30/12 10:57 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Many organizations talk about Web Governance, but what is it – and why should you care? Simply put, Web Governance is a general term for the system of policies and guidelines you use for making decisions about your organization’s web presence. This system may be ill-defined and poorly organized, but it’s important to realize that you already have Web Governance. Thus, it makes sense to start working with Web Governance by mapping your organization’s current state of Web Governance.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Tell users about your cookies

\n

\nPosted by\nMie Elmkvist Jensen\n

\n

\n5/23/12 11:04 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Online privacy is a global hot-button, with lawmakers pressuring organizations to more tightly regulate the information they gather from visitors. The European Union recently enacted legislation dubbed the "cookie directive" has organizations scrambling to make their websites compliant. Many organizations in the US may not realize that they need to comply with these rules if they intend to operate a website in the EU. For those of you who don't run multiple sites, these simple tips may give you a head start preparing for future US legislation.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

What is Web Governance?

\n

\nPosted by\nBo Vejgaard\n

\n

\n3/28/12 11:42 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Make your web presence an asset

\n
\n

Web governance is about ensuring full control over the organization's web presence by means of well thought out clear decision-making structures. For some, the organization's web presence is at best a necessary expense, and at worst a risk of legal actions, hacker attacks or the unwanted release of sensitive information. With sensible web governance you can turn the organization's web presence into a valuable asset.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

Recent Posts

\n
\n
\n

5 Reasons Why Your Website Content Isn’t Influencing Readers

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n7/1/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

Humanizing the digital world is no simple task. Thanks to the rapid advances in technology, the expansion of social media, and the ever growing influence of the Internet, consumers are growing more and more savvy by the day. They also have more choices than ever before, which means you have more competition than ever before. So the question becomes, how to distance yourself from competitors and convince consumers that your product/service/organization is the best option for them?

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance,\nContent Governance,\nContent\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Why Blogging Should Be Part Of Your Web Governance Strategy

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n6/24/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

The “too long; didn’t read” version? It’s good for business. Oh, you’re still there. Well then let’s elaborate on that a little bit. When done correctly, blogging is arguably the most important, and most effective, inbound marketing tactic your organization can utilize. According to HubSpot, blogging regularly will result in more sales leads, more site visits, and more social media engagement. See? We told you it’s good for business.

\n

Now, for you detail-oriented readers, let’s take a closer look at how blogging can have a positive impact on your other marketing and web governance strategies and help you reach your online marketing goals.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance,\nContent Governance,\nContent\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Content Marketing and Website Governance are, like, Totally BFFs

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n6/10/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

“Keep telling me what to do and what to buy”, said no consumer ever. Mass marketing tactics such as TV, print, and radio were once the staples of every marketing strategy. But, thanks to the Internet, they have seen their share of the budget eaten away by a new brand of more carefully curated strategies that are able to leverage websites, social media, and email. One such strategy is Content Marketing, which aims to attract a highly targeted audience by developing and sharing content that has been designed specifically with them in mind.   

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance,\nContent Governance,\nContent\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

The Cost of Your Website's Broken Links

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n5/29/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

It may not seem like much on the surface, but deep down, a broken link is doing some serious damage to your website, your reputation, and your business. A single broken link can impact your search engine rankings, your site’s user experience, result in lost customers and revenue, or everyone’s favorite- all of the above.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

What We Learned At Confab Central 2014

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n5/22/14 9:30 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

What is Confab? It’s a 3-day conference aimed at sharing knowledge among professionals who understand the value of creating awesome content. People with backgrounds in Marketing, Design, User Experience, I.T., and Business all come together and challenge one another to think about things in new ways, approach problems with new tactics, and share their successes and #EpicFails in equal measure.

\n

We went as knowledge sponges. Here’s some of the stuff we soaked up.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nContent\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

How The Evolving SEO Landscape Is Impacting Your Website

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n5/20/14 9:30 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

Search engine algorithms are getting smarter; Google in particular. Until recently, cramming your webpages with keywords and outbound links was enough to trick them into thinking that your website was relevant to the search terms. As more and more people began to “game” the system, Google got wise and decided to change the game. Get up to speed on the new rules.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

How Will the Net Neutrality Rulings Impact Consumers and Businesses?

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n5/9/14 9:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

The debate over Net Neutrality has intensified once again and will likely continue to do so as Internet Service Providers like Comcast and Verizon push for a Federal Communications Commission (FCC) ruling in their favor on May 20, 2014. The outcome of this debate could have drastic impacts on the way consumers and businesses use the Internet as a communication and information sharing platform, so make sure you know what it could mean for you and your company.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nContent\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Take a Load Off: Reduce Your Workload Through Website Automation

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n5/6/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

We’ve all been there: deadlines are looming and there just aren’t enough hours in the day to meet them all. Website management teams are often too busy putting out fires and treading water to look for smarter ways to work, so we’ve taken it upon ourselves to do the research for you. Here are 4 great ways that you can save yourself time on things you already do.

\n
\nRead More\n

Web Governance from an SEO Point of View

\n

\nPosted by\nThea Straub\n

\n

\n10/31/12 3:33 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

There are a lot of similarities between Search Engine Optimization (SEO) today and the “dot-com bubble” of the 1990s: Back then people were buying websites they didn’t really understand or have a plan to use, simply because everyone else had one.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Are you planning to launch a mobile version of your website? Here are a few ideas for the design of the search function for the mobile site.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nEnterprise Search\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Smart phone sales are exploding, and the desire to make websites accessible to all users on mobile platforms is also increasing. I’m going to give you some tips on how to create accessible web content in the best way.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Roles and responsibilities in Web Governance

\n

\nPosted by\nBo Vejgaard\n

\n

\n10/10/12 3:59 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Do all employees in your organization know what their role is, and what is expected of them? Do employees know who to ask questions outside their own work area? Do you know what every employee in your web team does?

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Carefully Selected Content: Website Redesign Tips From a Search Perspective

\n

\nPosted by\nBarbara Hammer-Aebi\n

\n

\n10/3/12 4:05 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

The Siteimprove series on maximizing the potential of a website redesign continues with today's post on the internal search function. We'll take a look at ideas on how your internal search can be used as a helping tool in the general design and testing of your website, as well as guidance on how to best design your search page.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Celebrating 10 Years of Siteimprove Success

\n

\nPosted by\nJessica O'Sullivan\n

\n

\n10/1/13 1:58 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Today, 1 October 2013, SaaS company Siteimprove celebrate 10 years of success since first opening in 2003. Having started from humble entrepreneurship roots, Siteimprove has grown exponentially to become a truly successful global company with more than 80 employees, with offices in five countries and customers in 11 countries.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO,\nAccessibility,\nEnterprise Search,\nWeb Governance,\nResponsibility,\nWeb Analytics\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Siteimprove Sponsors Annual NAGW Pinnacle Awards

\n

\nPosted by\nJosh Ditthardt\n

\n

\n9/23/13 10:17 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n

  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Siteimprove is proud to announce that they will again be sponsoring the Pinnacle Awards at the National Association of Government Webmasters (NAGW) conference, held from September 24-27 in Louisville, Kentucky.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance,\nResponsibility\n

\n
\n
\n

\n4/25/12 11:21 AM\n

    \n

\n
\n
\n

At Siteimprove we work with Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) as an essential part of the growth we experience in our three main markets in the UK, USA and in Denmark. A lot of initiatives have already been introduced, for instance we work hard to contribute to a higher degree of Web Accessibility on public and private websites. We wish to minimize our carbon footprint and offer our employees a sound and exciting working environment, in order to encourage employees to create new and even better Web Governance solutions for our customers.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nResponsibility\n

Putting a Face on Accessibility

\n

\nPosted by\nKevin Rydberg\n

\n

\n4/29/13 10:25 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

All too often we forget to put a face on people with disabilities, instead we lump them into categories.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

The 'Publication' Component of Content Strategy Success

\n

\nPosted by\nJessica O'Sullivan\n

\n

\n4/22/13 4:04 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Having your content published was once difficult, yet with the emergence of the new media age entry requirements have almost all but disappeared. Instead, the internet has made it possible for almost everyone to share their content, but this isn’t without risks.

\n
\n
\n

With the increasing digitization of the business world, it has now become essential for organizations to become publishers in order to compete against competitors, and gain attention from their target audiences. Yet haphazard publishing can be dangerous for an organization's reputation, especially if standards of reliability, accountability, accuracy and trust slip.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

The 'Creation' Component of Content Strategy Success

\n

\nPosted by\nJessica O'Sullivan\n

\n

\n4/16/13 4:09 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Previously we introduced the concept of ‘content strategy,’ and explained the three essential components that constitute its lifecycle – creation, publication, and governance. In this blog, will delve deeper into how Siteimprove can assist you during the first component: ‘creation.’

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

The three components of Content Strategy success

\n

\nPosted by\nJack Oldham\n

\n

\n4/8/13 2:48 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Creating effective website content can be an arduous task, especially when so many factors must be considered: varying role capacities, internal politics, customer expectations etc. However, following a structured strategy can make creating focused content a piece of cake!

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

3 Tips For Creating An Effective Website Content Calendar

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n9/30/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

With the demand for consistent, high-quality web content growing on a daily basis, creating a Content Calendar is the best way to coordinate and organize your content marketing efforts and ensure that your brand remains top of mind with your core audience.

\n

Content Calendars will vary from organization to organization, but by compiling all of your goals, assets, and ideas in a single document, you’ll be able to piece together what can turn into an otherwise unruly and chaotic puzzle.

\n

Ready? Set? Go.

\n

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance,\nContent Governance,\nContent,\nWebsite Redesign\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Web Accessibility Checklist

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n9/23/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

Our reliance on technology in everyday life continues to grow at an alarming rate. I’m willing to wager that the majority of you are reading this on a computer, your smartphone is within arm’s reach, there’s a tablet tucked away in your bag, and you may have even snuck in some TV time today. Some of our closest relationships are the ones we have with our screens and devices, floating in the pixelated waves of the digital sea. Despite how we may feel about being so reliant on our technology, there’s no denying the benefits offered by the latest and greatest gear, gadgets, and gizmos.

\n

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility,\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Accessible Website Multimedia

\n

\nPosted by\nKevin Rydberg\n

\n

\n9/18/14 12:27 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

According to HubSpot, multimedia content is more engaging and shareable than its text-only counterparts. Making this content more accessible for your users is a simple process, so long as you take web accessibility guidelines into account while adding this kind of content to your website. With improvements in bandwidth, as well as browsers and media players, you have an opportunity to deliver an engaging, rich media experience to your visitors. Unfortunately, if you don’t prepare properly, the experience will be less accessible, and more frustrating to your visitors.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Website SEO Checklist

\n

\nPosted by\nMike Waterston\n

\n

\n9/9/14 10:05 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

What Google says, goes. They are the Alpha and Omega when it comes to online search, and their search algorithm is what dictates how your website’s SEO needs to be calibrated. In order to receive the maximum return on your online investment, your website’s SEO needs to cross off a number of key to-do’s before it can reap the rewards from Skynet Google.

\n

If you haven’t been keeping up with Google’s latest algorithm updates, read our blog that discussed the evolving SEO landscape. Go ahead and read it, I’ll wait.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO,\nWeb Governance,\nContent Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Learning From Web Governance Anarchy In The U.K

\n

\nPosted by\nShane Diffily\n

\n

\n9/2/14 9:59 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

Have you ever heard the expression "democracy is a precious ambrosia carried around in the rusty bucket of human endeavor"?

\n

Well, rarely has that bucket been more rusty than when applied to governmental web governance.

\n

Experience shows that after lots of initial enthusiasm and conspicuous spending, many official sites quickly go into decline.

\n

The problem is that creating a website is now a box-ticking exercise - characterized by poorly understood goals and inadequate support.

\n

Thankfully, that is starting to change. 

\n

\n
\nRead More\n
\n

\n

User Feedback - Building a closer relationship with your users

\n

\nPosted by\nCamilla Simonsen\n

\n

\n6/27/12 10:41 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Communicating with your users online often comes in the form of one way communication. This makes it hard for you to gain insight into what users actually think about your website. In this blog details how user feedback helps build a closer relationship with users, based on a case study of a municipal website in Denmark the Siteimprove has carried out since December 2011.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nWeb Analytics\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Four good ideas on how to find the right keywords

\n

\nPosted by\nThea Straub\n

\n

\n6/20/12 10:48 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Keywords are at the very heart of search engine optimization and finding the right keywords can make or break your SEO success. It is therefore very important to find the right keywords to target. It is impossible to optimize your website for all interesting keywords, so you will want to start out with the most important ones. Here, we will give you four good ideas on how to find the right keywords.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

\n

\nPosted by\nDave Schneider\n

\n

\n6/13/12 10:50 AM\n

It's official: we're fun.

Topics:\nWeb Governance\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Dive into search statistics

\n

\nPosted by\nBarbara Hammer-Aebi\n

\n

\n6/6/12 10:54 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Search statistics are not only essential for evaluating and maintaining the search function on your website, they are also useful for many other purposes. It is a free opportunity to learn about what your users expect from your website. Do you have the information users need? Is it well organized, and is it easy to click though to the pages that are most sought after?

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n
\n\n\n\n\n\n\n 9792121443:\n\n\n\n\n\nHow To Quickly Clean Up Disorganized Web Content\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
    \n
  • Features
    • \n

    • \n

    • \n

    • \n

Siteimprove Web Governance Blog

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

\nHow To Quickly Clean Up Disorganized Web Content\n

\n

\nPosted by\nDave Schneider\n

\n

\n7/8/14 10:00 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n

\n
\n

If you’re feeling overwhelmed by the prospect of cleaning up your website content, the suggestion to “get an overview of your content” may sound glib and unhelpful, but it really doesn’t need to be more complicated than that.

\n
\n

There are plenty of tools available to assist you in putting together an overview, so there’s no reason to ever waste your time manually creating a website inventory.

\n\n

Free tools may require a bit more manual effort, whereas paid tools offer greater speed and ease of use. Whatever your budget is, any tool will be much faster and more accurate than having a student worker copy and paste page titles into a spreadsheet.

\n

When evaluating whether free or paid tools are best for your organization, consider which of the basic three project ingredients are most important to you: speed, quality, and price. 

\n

\n

In order to get an overview you can actually use, make sure your tool(s) at least provide a complete list of:

\n
    \n
  • A full XML Sitemap
    • \n
  • Hosted documents (PDFs, Word, Excel, etc.)
    • \n
  • Contact information (email addresses, phone numbers, etc.)
    • \n
  • Broken links
    • \n
  • Misspellings
    • \n
  • Pages ordered by popularity (number of page views)
    • \n
\n

Once you have your content overview, you’re ready to begin cleaning.

\n

Step 1: Fix website errors

\n

Fixing all the errors that affect key pages is the single fastest way to make a noticeable improvement to the usability of your website. Broken links are more than just detrimental to your search engine rankings; they’re a virtual roadblock to your users and potential customers when they try to locate information on your site. Most visitors head straight to their favorite search engine after hitting a broken link, never to return.

\n

Misspellings are similarly disastrous to your user experience, destroying your organization’s credibility and reducing conversions by up to 50%. Fixing these issues is a simple and straightforward task that will dramatically increase your web content quality and give you a quick win.  

\n

Step 2: Remove unused content

\n

With Google Analytics

\n

Log in to your website’s analytics tool and sort your pages by page views over the past year.

\n

On your dashboard menu, click “Behavior,” then “Site Content,” then “All Pages.” Then click the “Pageviews” column header to sort by number of page views. 

\n

\n

 

\n

You may notice many pages that have titles beginning with a question mark followed by lots of seemingly random characters. This is tracking information, and often not an accurate representation of how many views the page in question has actually had. Skip those for now.

\n

Google Analytics is limited to displaying pages that have had at least one page view during the time period you select, so pages with zero views will not appear in this list.

\n

With Siteimprove

\n

If you’re a Siteimprove customer, you can view your least viewed pages under the “Inventory” section by clicking the “Pages” option. There you’ll see a list of pages with the least views, how many pages link to them on your site, the date they were added, a calculation of the page quality, number of views and page level on your site. 

\n

\n

 

\n

Step 3: Refresh outdated content

\n

Now that you’ve slimmed down the number of pages on your website, you’re ready to update the remaining content. This may require a bit more thought and planning than fixing errors or deleting unused pages, so you’ll feel better if you do it after you’ve already enjoyed some progress.

\n

Start by searching for expired contact information:

\n
    \n
  • Names of employees who have left your organization
    • \n
  • Phone numbers
    • \n
  • Email addresses
    • \n
  • Mailing addresses
    • \n
\n

If possible, log in to your CMS and sort your pages by last update. Many CMSs offer this functionality, but if yours doesn’t, use your website’s search bar to check for signs of outdated content:

\n\n
    \n
  • “2010/2011/2012”
    • \n
  • Names of events, projects or initiatives which may no longer be valid
    • \n
  • Old slogans or terminology
    • \n
\n

\n

Next, check your hosted documents, as these are commonly forgotten when updating information on the website. Make sure the information is up to date, and convert any platform-specific documents (e.g. Microsoft Word files) to PDFs so that they can be opened on any device.

\n

Step 4: Create a long-term solution

\n

Fixing all the issues on your site is only a short-term solution. Those issues are symptoms of a much larger issue, which is a lack of structure and definition in website marketing efforts. If you don’t fix the root problem, your website will quickly go back to being disorganized and confusing.

\n

Fortunately, the long-term solution is readily available and completely free: web governance. By creating web governance for your organization, you can effectively prevent your website from returning to its previous state of disrepair.

\n

Learn how to manage your web content and organize your team in this free on-demand webinar1

\n

\n \n \n

\n

 

\n
\n

Topics:\nWeb Governance,\nContent Governance,\nContent\n

\n
\nVoyager\n
\n
\nGreat post, organising content on big sites is often a big and time consuming task.\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n\n
\n
\n

Say goodbye to inaccessible PDFs on your website

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n

\n4/10/14 11:34 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n

”We can’t upload PDFs to our website because PDFs are not accessible“ and “We have to provide an accessible version of our PDFs since it is not possible to make PDFs accessible“ are both common dilemmas experienced among web teams. Perhaps these are sentences you’ve heard or even used yourself?

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Raising Digital Discrimination Awareness

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n

\n5/21/13 3:57 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Imagine that you’re suddenly blind, maybe unable to make your body function as it did before, perhaps you can no longer read without difficulty or distinguish between colors, conceivably you may just be getting older… Now try accessing the web.

\n
\n
\n

Many people find it difficult to imagine what accessing the web may be like without the basic physical and cognitive traits we often take for granted. Aimed to get people talking, thinking and learning about the estimated 20% of the population with some kind of a disability, Global Accessibility Awareness Day has again concluded for another year - but not without some important lessons being learned the hard way.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Web Editors: Create Accessible Websites

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n

\n1/29/13 9:38 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n

As a web editor you are responsible for the content you publish on the website and it’s accessibility. Do you know how to support accessibility when you write texts and add images and links on a web page?

\n
\n
\n

This is the final blog post in a series of 3 that cover websites and accessibility with a role-based approach. This post is meant for web editors. The previous was intended for web designers and for web developers. I will give concrete tips on how to create an accessible web site.

\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Web Developers: Create an Accessible Website

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n

\n1/2/13 2:35 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Are you developing your website for many types of users, or are you primarily developing for people who access websites in much the same way as you do? Do you know how dyslexic users, people who are colorblind, people with impairments and others navigate the web?

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

The Web Designer's Guide on How to Create Accessible GUIs

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n

\n12/12/12 2:58 PM\n

\n\n

    \n

    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

As a web designer, several accessibility criteria are especially important to help you ensure as many users as possible can use your web application.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Integrate Accessibility in Your Web Governance

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n

\n11/21/12 3:11 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Web accessibility isn’t something that is ensured solely through a website development project. To be successful, accessibility has to be a part of the overall web governance strategy.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

13 Tips to Improve Your Website for Mobile Users and Disabled Users at the Same Time

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

New website – Think web accessibility from day 1

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

If you are about to redesign your website, now is a good time to focus on getting a website that can be used by as many people as possible. Here are some tips on when and how to make requirements and focus on accessibility throughout the process.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Avoid These Common Accessibility Mistakes

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n

\n8/8/12 4:47 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n

    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Find out if you use alternative texts, headings and forms correctly and if you in general help people with disabilities and dyslexia etc. on your website

\n

In this blog, we'll cover several common misunderstandings in connection with accessibility problems on websites. Find out whether your website is doing it right or wrong.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Want to understand accessibility? Participate!

\n

\nPosted by\nHelene Nørgaard Bech\n

\n

\n7/4/12 10:37 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Why is it important to be able to use a webpage without using a computer mouse? How does it work when a web page text is enlarged? How does a screen reader interpret a web page? Get the answers to these questions and learn why and to whom this is important.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n
\n\n\n\n\n\n\n 9792126253:\n\n\n\n\n\nAre you ready to manage smart-phone access on your website? \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
    \n
  • Features
    • \n
  • Industries
    • \n
  • Knowledge
    • \n
  • About
    • \n

\n

\n
\n

\n

\n
\n
\n

Siteimprove Web Governance Blog

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

\nAre you ready to manage smart-phone access on your website? \n

\n

\nPosted by\nJessica O'Sullivan\n

\n

\n7/25/12 5:11 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n

By taking a quick glance at mobile web statistics, we can see an obvious increase in mobile phone users. Every indication points to this trend only continuing to grow. According to an analysis by Morgan Stanley, it is estimated that the number of Internet users who access the Internet through mobile units will exceed the number of users who access the Internet from traditional computers in 2014. The analysis is from 2010 and whether the results will prove true in 2014 is hard to say, but larger and better screens on smart phones, more powerful processors and flat-rate data subscriptions have an influence on the process.

\n
\n\n
\n

The need of more smart phone available websites

\n

As explained above, the forward increased Internet use through mobile units requires a focus on optimizing websites to support mobile units. On many websites, especially older ones, the creators have not at all considered that users also need to access the websites through mobile units with screen sizes down to 320x480 pixels.

\n

If a website only is optimized to screen sizes with more than 1024 pixels across, it causes problems for mobile user experience and likelihood of a repeat visit. Mobile users typically lose the overview of the site, because they need to zoom in to read the text. At the same time, buttons and navigation are developed for mouse and keyboard use, instead of touchscreens.

\n

But a 1:1 development of a mobile version of a website is often an expensive solution, especially if external consultants is needed for the development work. Furthermore, technical challenges may arise in relation to how the solutions should be created. Most people know that iOS (iPhone, iPod and iPad) don't support Flash.

\n

User pattern on mobile units

\n

Normally, the user patterns on mobile devices are different from what are seen from standard PC-users. The statistics show that the involvement and the time spent on the websites is low and the bounce rate is high. All this tells us that the mobile users don't "surf" the net, but are instead looking for very specific information.

\n

The same pattern shows when we look at which content the mobile users view. They typically access sites with information on opening hours, contact information or prices.

\n

Analysis data for a mobile strategy

\n

Because of the difference in user behavior when accessing websites through mobile units, it is important to look at the structure of a website. As mentioned earlier, a 1:1 solution where the content is transferred to a site optimized for mobile units is often an expensive solution, but it's possible to use the analysis data to create a strategy to determine which pages should be optimized for mobile units.

\n

Try to map out the behavior of those users who visit your website through mobile units and look at the involvement as well as what content they most often view. You will see a clear tendency in what the users look for when they visit your website through a mobile device.

\n

If the top 10 visited pages are 90% of the page views in connection with mobile  access, then it would be a good starting point to optimize those 10 pages and make them functional to users who access the website through mobile devices.

\n

Doing this can make a seemingly impossible web project, the development of an entire mobile version of your website, reduced to the optimization of few strategic pages.

\n

\n \n \n

\n

 

\n
\n
\n

Topics:\nWeb Analytics\n

Recent Posts

\n

Top 5 SEO and Accessibility Overlaps

\n

\nPosted by\nThea Straub\n

\n

\n1/16/13 10:34 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Did you know that guidelines and best practices for SEO and web accessibility have many overlaps, and that with a little consideration you can kill two birds with one stone? We give you our top five areas that make your website more searchable and at the same time accessible for more users.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO,\nAccessibility\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Web Governance from an SEO Point of View

\n

\nPosted by\nThea Straub\n

\n

\n10/31/12 3:33 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

There are a lot of similarities between Search Engine Optimization (SEO) today and the “dot-com bubble” of the 1990s: Back then people were buying websites they didn’t really understand or have a plan to use, simply because everyone else had one.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

9 Ways to Keep Your Search Rankings During a Website Redesign

\n

\nPosted by\nThea Straub\n

\n

\n9/12/12 4:28 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Getting a new website can be like walking into a minefield in terms of search engine optimization. Worst case scenario, you could lose all your search engine rankings and will have to start from scratch. Luckily, this doesn’t have to happen - as long as you do the transition the right way.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and Mobile Websites

\n

\nPosted by\nThea Straub\n

\n

\n8/1/12 4:55 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Last week's blog post was about the need for mobile websites. And if your website isn't already mobile friendly, you're probably thinking of doing something about it. However, not all mobile websites are particularly search engine friendly, so in this blog post we will briefly present 3 options to help you make the right decisions on how to go about building your mobile website.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

On page optimization post panda: 3 tips to future-proof your website

\n

\nPosted by\nThea Straub\n

\n

\n7/18/12 5:24 PM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Google regularly updates the algorithm that calculates a page's relevance to a given search. Last year in February came the much debated panda update, which has since been updated many times, even as recently as April of this year. Having just returned from the Search Marketing Expo in London, we have lots of good ideas on how to ensure that the content on your website meets the new requirements.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Topics:\nSEO\n

\n
\n
\n
\n

Four good ideas on how to find the right keywords

\n

\nPosted by\nThea Straub\n

\n

\n6/20/12 10:48 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n

Keywords are at the very heart of search engine optimization and finding the right keywords can make or break your SEO success. It is therefore very important to find the right keywords to target. It is impossible to optimize your website for all interesting keywords, so you will want to start out with the most important ones. Here, we will give you four good ideas on how to find the right keywords.

\n
\n
\nRead More\n

Siteimprove Web Governance Blog

\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n

\nThe Dollars and Cents of Web Governance\n

\n

\nPosted by\nDave Schneider\n

\n

\n11/6/12 11:51 AM\n

\n
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • \n\nTweet\n
    • \n
  • \n\n\n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
  • \n\n
    \n
    • \n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n
\n

One of the biggest reasons we hear people say they don’t have a solid web governance strategy is because they lack the time and money required to implement it. What they often don’t realize is that time and money are exactly what a web governance strategy saves. In this post, we’ll be presenting a few examples from several other industries who have already spent the time and money to discover the savings offered by web governance.

\n
\n
\n

Minimizing Costs With Self-Service

\n

Many local governments, service providers, and other organizations utilize self-service to reduce internal costs. This process is commonly referred to as "channel shift." When users can go onto your website and find the information they want, pay bills, and help themselves it frees your staff up to do other important things, saving you time and money.

Banks offer an excellent look at the quantifiable difference that working self-service can make: A study conducted by TowerGroup Estimates found that the average transactional cost of online banking was just $0.20, while the average phone call cost $2.40. Simply by encouraging customers to use the self-service functions of their websites, banks can save millions of dollars per year.

So what if you're not a bank? You probably still have self-service portions of your website. Whether it's hours of operation, your street address, or an FAQ, there's information helping users find what they're looking for. And if they can't find it, they'll call you for assistance - which costs you money. $2.40/phone call adds up pretty quickly.  

\n

Reducing Lost Leads

\n

Colleges and universities live and die by their ability to recruit prospective students. According to a study by Noel-levitz, 20% of all college students report crossing a school off their list of prospective schools because of a bad experience with the website. Simply by having errors and poorly laid out content, colleges and universities risk losing up to 20% of their total prospective students and revenue.

This same principle applies to any organization: For ecommerce sites, one British analysis concluded that the presence of even a single spelling error in an online store can cut sales in half.

\n

Increasing Customer Retention

\n

The following example is from one of our own customers:
In 2012, BOSCH Communications signed on with us and spent the first month of their service fixing the broken links that had inevitably creeped on to their site.  Most of these broken links were within the online content libraries intended to help customers utilize their products and services.

The next month after fixing their broken links, their analytics program showed that the average time spent on their website had increased by 56%. Because they had not made any other significant changes to the website, the web manager attributes the increase to users no longer hitting dead links and giving up their search in frustration.    

\n

'Summing up' Web Governance 

\n

This blog only touches the surface on the added benefits of investing and doing Web Governance right. Although implementing a strategy may appear daunting at first, it really needn't be. There's a great opportunity to give your users what they want and in turn reduce your service costs, particularly if your web governance strategy seeks to leverage present and future developments. 

\n

\n \n \n

\n
\n
\n
